titleStmt.title: Letter, William Randolph Hackley in Yazoo City, Miss., to his wife 1866 Nov. 13

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, William Randolph Hackley in Yazoo City, Miss., to his wife 1866 Nov. 13

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: As I write twice a week and there is nothing of interest to you in this place you will have to be contented with short letters The result of last weeks fees are $136, besides my daily pay. expenses for board lodging office rent and blanks about $20, so one weeks fees pays your expenses for a month but it is very tiresome in the long evenings and I daily wish for your company, we have had one hard front which makes the leaves fall fastly no vegetables but sweet potatoes and I am afraid to eat them tho I feel very well again and using only cistern water hope to keep all right, I hope to hear from Tommy this week and hope to get somewhere where there is Lots of Cotton for I do want to get him once more. I hope you are all comfortable and pleased with your mode of living and that you have recd the money I desired Athearn to send you from Memphis and that the muffs arrived safe - I expect to get some other skins in a few days those I expected were not brought in kiss the children for me
